subject: National Security Concept of Georgia
document(english): Diplomats urge Georgia to ratify cybersecurity strategy at 1st Cyber Security Forum in Tbilisi 05/10/2022, 22:58Diplomats urge Georgia to ratify cybersecurity strategy at 1st Cyber Security Forum in Tbilisi Page 1 of 3 Diplomats urge Georgia to ratify cybersecurity strategy at 1st Cyber Security Forum in Tbilisi The first cyber security forum was organised by Georgia’s National SecurityThe first cyber security forum was organised by Georgia’s National Security Council, with the support of the government of Georgia. Photo: government ofCouncil, with the support of the government of Georgia. Photo: government of Georgia press office.Georgia press office. Agenda.ge, 25 Sep 2020 - 13:54, Tbilisi,Georgia The first Cyber Security Forum in Tbilisi has been held by the government of Georgia to identify problems in Georgian cybersecurity and find ways to settle them with the involvement of the diplomatic corps and international institutions. US Ambassador to Georgia Kelly Degnan has urged the government to urgently ratify the national cybersecurity strategy and an action plan. She said that roles and duties should be clearly defined in the field for the existing problems to be resolved. Degnan said that proper cybersecurity protection during the election period is of ‘the utmost importance’. U.S. Embassy Tbilisi @usingeo · Follow The United States will continue to work together with international donor community to support our Georgian partners in achieving their cybersecurity goals. ge.usembassy.gov/ambassador-deg… 1:53 PM · Sep 25, 2020 Read the full conversation on Twitter 29 Reply Share Read more on Twitter US Ambassador Degnan: Russia is likely to interfere in Georgian elections ( Russia denies cyber attack against Georgia, accuses Tbilisi, Washington, London of ‘joint, anti-Russian propaganda’ ( The EU Ambassador to Georgia Carl Hartzell said Georgia has achieved progress in cybersecurity and ‘the country’s positions in international rankings ( prove this.’ Georgia becomes member of NATO cyber security platform ( He said that Georgia should continue its efforts to ensure better cybersecurity and make changes to the law. ! ! ! (HTTPS://WWW.GOOGLE.COM/) However, Hartzell said that ensuring cybersecurity should not take place at the expense of the violation of human rights or personal data. Hartzell praised the Georgian government for organising the ‘very important forum.’ Georgian Prime Minister Giorgi Gakharia said that ahead of ‘very important elections’ the issues, risks and challenges related to cybersecurity may turn into a serious challenge for the country. Gakharia stated that the forum should play its ‘big role’ in strengthening Georgia's national security. He said that over the past 12 years Georgia has faced several cyber attacks, including the ones by Russia back in 2008, 2019 and earlier this year. Georgia accuses Russia of widespread cyber attack ( US Embassy condemns cyber attack on Ministry of Health, Lugar Lab ( Gakharia said that it is important for Georgia to have a special body that will coordinate sectoral agencies in the security field. He thanked allies for ‘very valuable support’ for national cybersecurity. I believe that none of the states are able to cope with cybersecurity challenges alone. That is why the EU is trying to create a multi party framework where we will work with all our partners, including Georgia,” Hartzell said. საქართველოს მთავრობა about 2 years ago გიორგი გახარია - ვაცნობიერებთ, რომ წინ ძალიან მნიშვნელოვანი არჩევნები გველის, ხოლო კიბერსივრცესთან დაკავშირებული საკითხები, რისკები და საფრთხეები შეიძლება ჩვენი ქვეყნისთვის მნიშვნელოვან გამოწვევად იქცეს ჩვენ ვაცნობიერებთ, რომ წინ ძალიან მნიშვნელოვანი არჩევნები გველის, ხოლო კიბერსივრცესთან დაკავშირებული საკითხები, რისკები და საფრთხეები შეიძლება ჩვენი ქვეყნისთვის მნიშვნელოვან გამოწვევად იქცეს, - ამის შესახებ საქართველოს პრემიერ-მინისტრმა გიორგი გახარიამ საქართველოს კიბერუსაფრთ See more 841 22 28 +21 ! !  RELATED NEWS 05/10/2022, 22:58Diplomats urge Georgia to ratify cybersecurity strategy at 1st Cyber Security Forum in Tbilisi Page 3 of 3 copyright © 2013 - 2022. Photo: government ofCouncil, with the support of the government of Georgia. Photo: government of Georgia press office.Georgia press office.  Agenda.ge, 25 Sep 2020 - 13:54, Tbilisi,Georgia  The first Cyber Security Forum in Tbilisi has been held by the government of Georgia to identify problems in Georgian cybersecurity and find ways to settle them with the involvement of the diplomatic corps and international institutions.   US Ambassador to Georgia Kelly Degnan has urged the government to urgently ratify the national cybersecurity strategy and an action plan.  She said that roles and duties should be clearly defined in the field for the existing problems to be resolved.   Degnan said that proper cybersecurity protection during the election period is of ‘the utmost importance’.
